entities.name: House Targaryen
entities.description: Dragonlords of ancient lineage who escaped the Doom of Valyria and settled on Dragonstone before conquering Westeros.

relationships.description: Aegon I rode the dragon Balerion.
relationships.evidence: Of the five dragons who had flown with Aenar the Exile from Valyria, only one survived to Aegon’s day: the great beast called Balerion, the Black Dread.

relationships.description: Visenya rode the dragon Vhagar.
relationships.evidence: The dragons Vhagar and Meraxes were younger... Visenya, eldest of the three siblings... descended on them from above with Vhagar

relationships.description: Rhaenys rode the dragon Meraxes.
relationships.evidence: Rhaenys... loved to fly. She once was heard to say that before she died she meant to fly Meraxes across the Sunset Sea

relationships.description: Aegon I married his sister Visenya.
relationships.evidence: Aegon took both his sisters to bride... Aegon wed Visenya out of duty

relationships.description: Aegon I married his sister Rhaenys.
relationships.evidence: Aegon took both his sisters to bride... Rhaenys out of desire.

relationships.description: Aegon I wielded the sword Blackfyre.
relationships.evidence: Armed with the Valyrian steel blade Blackfyre, he was counted amongst the greatest warriors of his age

relationships.description: Visenya wielded the sword Dark Sister.
relationships.evidence: She carried the Valyrian longsword Dark Sister, and was skilled in its use

relationships.description: Aegon I and Balerion burned Harrenhal, killing Harren the Black.
relationships.evidence: Harren and his last sons died in the fires that engulfed his monstrous fortress that night.

relationships.description: Orys Baratheon slew Argilac the Arrogant in single combat.
relationships.evidence: in the end the last of the Durrandon got his wish, and died with a sword in his hand... Orys Baratheon unchained her... took the arms and words of the Durrandon for his own.

relationships.description: House Baratheon was founded by Orys, Aegon's half-brother and champion, and was sworn to Targaryen rule.
relationships.evidence: Orys Baratheon he proclaimed to be 'my shield, my stalwart, my strong right hand.'... The crowned stag became his sigil, Storm’s End became his seat

relationships.description: Aenys I was the son of Aegon I and Rhaenys.
relationships.evidence: son of Aegon I and Rhaenys

relationships.description: Maegor I was the son of Aegon I and Visenya.
relationships.evidence: son of Aegon I and Visenya

relationships.description: Jaehaerys I was the son of Aenys I.
relationships.evidence: Aenys’s son

relationships.description: Aegon II was the eldest son of Viserys I.
relationships.evidence: eldest son of Viserys

relationships.description: Rhaenyra was the daughter of Viserys I.
relationships.evidence: Aegon II’s ascent was disputed by his half-sister Rhaenyra

relationships.description: Aegon III was the son of Rhaenyra.
relationships.evidence: Rhaenyra’s son

relationships.description: Daeron I was the eldest son of Aegon III.
relationships.evidence: eldest son of Aegon III

relationships.description: Baelor I was the second son of Aegon III.
relationships.evidence: second son of Aegon III

relationships.description: Aegon IV was the eldest son of Viserys II.
relationships.evidence: eldest son of Viserys

relationships.description: Daeron II was the son of Aegon IV (or Aemon the Dragonknight).
relationships.evidence: Queen Naerys’s son, by Aegon or Aemon

relationships.description: Aerys I was the second son of Daeron II.
relationships.evidence: second son of Daeron II

relationships.description: Maekar I was the fourth son of Daeron II.
relationships.evidence: fourth son of Daeron II

relationships.description: Aegon V was the fourth son of Maekar I.
relationships.evidence: Maekar’s fourth son

relationships.description: Jaehaerys II was the second son of Aegon V.
relationships.evidence: second son of Aegon the Unlikely

relationships.description: Aerys II was the only son of Jaehaerys II.
relationships.evidence: only son of Jaehaerys II

relationships.description: Rhaegar was the heir of Aerys II.
relationships.evidence: his heir, the crown prince, Rhaegar Targaryen

relationships.description: Robert Baratheon slew Rhaegar Targaryen on the Trident.
relationships.evidence: slain by Robert Baratheon on the Trident
